channel.title: How to: Run a RSPS on a Linux Based VPS
channel.description:
[center][b][size=14pt]How to: Run a RSPS on a Linux Based VPS[/size][/b][/center]
[b][u]Information and Requirements:[/u][/b] - Why get a Linux Based VPS? Because it's cheaper than one with Windows on it plus it's still pretty easy to manage.
- How long will this take me? Anywhere from 10 to 60 minutes (depending on your Internet connection).
- Where can I buy a Linux based VPS? Pretty much here: [url=https://www.google.com/search?q=google+linux+vps&oq=google+linux+vps&aqs=chrome..69i57j69i64.3033j0j7&sourceid=chrome&espv=210&es_sm=93&ie=UTF-8#es_sm=93&espv=210&q=linux+vps]link[/url]
- Which software will I be needing in order to manage my server? There's a few, try [url=http://www.chiark.greenend.org.uk/~sgtatham/putty/download.html]PuTTY[/url] or [url=http://www.dartmouth.edu/comp/soft-comp/software/downloads/windows/ssh-sftp/install.html]SSH Secure Shell[/url].
[b][u]Getting Started:[/u][/b]
[b]I. Connecting to your VPS [/b] 1/ Install either software listed right above this section and launch it. 2/ Enter all information asked (Host name: Enter the IP of your VPS, Login: Usually is root, Password: Well your root password, Security or Authentification Details: by password) 3/ Save the key/profile ? Yes.
[b]II. Installing Java JDK[/b] Tip: You can install it directly from the repo, but google it if you really want to as it's different between OS 1/ Go to: [url=http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/index.html]The download page of Java's website[/url] 2/ Click on JDK [u]Two options:[/u] For SSH Shell: 3/ In the download list, download the file for Linux that has ".rpm" in it! (i586 or x64 depending on your VPS specifications) 4/ Click on the transfer file icon and grab your JDK installation file and drop it in the other section to download it on your VPS OR For Both: 3/ In the console (where you end up after connecting to your VPS) type [i]wget url[/i] where url = the download link of JDK 4/ Wait until it's fully installed and:
5/ type in: [i]./your-file-name[/i] (example: ./jdk-6u45-linux-i568.rpm.bin) [b]IF[/b] the file's extension is .bin else [i]rpm -ivh your-file-name[/i] (example: rpm -ivh jdk-6u45-linux-i568.rpm) [b]IF[/b] the file's extension is .rpm else [i]tar zxvf jre-7u7-linux-i586.tar.gz[/i] (example: tar zxvf jdk-7u7-linux-i586.tar.gz) [b]IF[/b] the file's extension is a .tar.__ else [i]unrar e -y your-file-name.rar[/i] (example: unrar e -y jdk-7u7-linux.rar) [b]IF[/b] the file's extension is a .rar however you'll need to install unrar (google it)
[b]III. Adding your server to your VPS[/b] Upload your file (in a zip) on a hosting file website and copy the given link. 1/ Back to your console and Type in: [i]wget your-link-here[/i] 2/ unzip it like so: [i]unzip filename.zip[/i] 3/ Go to where you placed your [i]run.bat[/i] file (the one that makes the server start) and type in: [i]edit filename.bat[/i] Once you're editing the file, remove all .bat code (@echo, pause, echo, ...) transform all ; into : and replace cp with classpath and replace "C:/...." by java and all specifications like -Xmx815m are to be removed.
[b]IV. Final touch[/b] You may download SCREEN so that your server doesn't shutdown when you close your terminal, but I won't be explaining this as there's a lot of info on the web about it.

[center][size=14pt]How to: Run a RSPS on a Linux Based VPS[/size][/center]

Information and Requirements:

  • Why get a Linux Based VPS?
    Because it’s cheaper than one with Windows on it plus it’s still pretty easy to manage.

  • How long will this take me?
    Anywhere from 10 to 60 minutes (depending on your Internet connection).

  • Where can I buy a Linux based VPS?
    Pretty much here: link

  • Which software will I be needing in order to manage my server?
    There’s a few, try PuTTY or SSH Secure Shell.

Getting Started:

I. Connecting to your VPS
1/ Install either software listed right above this section and launch it.
2/ Enter all information asked (Host name: Enter the IP of your VPS, Login: Usually is root, Password: Well your root password, Security or Authentification Details: by password)
3/ Save the key/profile ? Yes.

II. Installing Java JDK
Tip: You can install it directly from the repo, but google it if you really want to as it’s different between OS
1/ Go to: The download page of Java’s website
2/ Click on JDK
Two options:
For SSH Shell:
3/ In the download list, download the file for Linux that has “.rpm” in it! (i586 or x64 depending on your VPS specifications)
4/ Click on the transfer file icon and grab your JDK installation file and drop it in the other section to download it on your VPS
OR
For Both:
3/ In the console (where you end up after connecting to your VPS) type wget url where url = the download link of JDK
4/ Wait until it’s fully installed and:

5/ type in:
./your-file-name (example: ./jdk-6u45-linux-i568.rpm.bin) IF the file’s extension is .bin
else
rpm -ivh your-file-name (example: rpm -ivh jdk-6u45-linux-i568.rpm) IF the file’s extension is .rpm
else
tar zxvf jre-7u7-linux-i586.tar.gz (example: tar zxvf jdk-7u7-linux-i586.tar.gz) IF the file’s extension is a .tar.__
else
unrar e -y your-file-name.rar (example: unrar e -y jdk-7u7-linux.rar) IF the file’s extension is a .rar however you’ll need to install unrar (google it)

III. Adding your server to your VPS
Upload your file (in a zip) on a hosting file website and copy the given link.
1/ Back to your console and Type in: wget your-link-here
2/ unzip it like so: unzip filename.zip
3/ Go to where you placed your run.bat file (the one that makes the server start) and type in: edit filename.bat
Once you’re editing the file, remove all .bat code (@echo, pause, echo, …) transform all ; into : and replace cp with classpath and replace “C:/…” by java and all specifications like -Xmx815m are to be removed.

IV. Final touch
You may download SCREEN so that your server doesn’t shutdown when you close your terminal, but I won’t be explaining this as there’s a lot of info on the web about it.
